[File: token_utils.rs::TokenDataIdType::to_hash()] [Hash Function Weakness] Hash is computed via hash_str(to_string()) - can collisions in the underlying hash function allow attackers to create tokens with identical IDs? (Critical)

[File: token_utils.rs::TokenDataIdType::get_collection_data_id_hash()] [Derived Hash Mismatch] Collection hash is derived from token data - can inconsistency between this and actual CollectionData hash cause orphaned tokens? (Medium)

[File: token_utils.rs::TokenWriteSet::from_table_item_type()] [Type String Manipulation] Type matching uses string comparison - can attackers provide types like '0x3::token::Token ' (with space) to bypass type checking? (Medium)

[File: token_utils.rs::TokenWriteSet::from_table_item_type()] [Deserialization Error Handling] Errors are wrapped in context but not all paths validated - can malformed JSON cause panics in serde_json::from_value? (Medium)
[File: token_utils.rs::RoyaltyType] [Royalty Points Overflow] Both numerator and denominator are BigDecimals - can extremely large values cause overflow in royalty calculation arithmetic? (Medium)

[File: token_utils.rs::TokenDataType] [Property Map BCS Deserialization] default_properties deserialized from BCS hex - can malicious BCS encoding trigger buffer overflows or memory corruption in deserializer? (High)

[File: token_utils.rs::TokenEvent::from_event()] [Event Type Spoofing] Event types matched by string - can custom events with similar names ('0x3::token::MintTokenEventt' with extra 't') bypass detection? (Medium)

[File: token_utils.rs::TokenResource::from_resource()] [Resource Type Confusion] is_resource_supported checked before parsing - but can attacker provide data that passes type check but contains malicious payloads? (Medium)

[File: token_utils.rs::Table::get_handle()] [Address Standardization Inconsistency] Handle is standardized but original format stored - can this cause lookup failures when querying table_handle_to_owner? (Medium)
[File: token_utils.rs::truncate_str()] [Unicode Boundary Issues] Truncation to byte length - can truncating mid-UTF8 character cause invalid strings or parsing errors? (Low)

[File: token_claims.rs::CurrentTokenPendingClaim::from_write_table_item()] [Offer/Token Type Mismatch] Expects TokenOfferId as key and Token as value - can mismatched types be provided to create invalid pending claims? (High)

[File: token_claims.rs::CurrentTokenPendingClaim::from_write_table_item()] [Missing Table Metadata Warning] When table metadata missing, only logs warning - can this allow claims without proper from_address tracking? (High)

[File: token_claims.rs::CurrentTokenPendingClaim::from_delete_table_item()] [Panic on Missing Metadata] Uses unwrap_or_else with panic! - can attacker trigger panics by deleting claims with unknown table handles, crashing indexer? (Critical)

[File: token_claims.rs::CurrentTokenPendingClaim::from_delete_table_item()] [Zero Amount on Delete] Deleted claims set amount to zero - can this be exploited to hide claim history or manipulate pending claim statistics? (Medium)

[File: token_claims.rs::CurrentTokenPendingClaim::from_write_table_item()] [From/To Address Validation] Addresses standardized but not validated - can claims be created between invalid addresses? (Medium)

[File: token_claims.rs::CurrentTokenPendingClaim] [Primary Key Complexity] PK is (token_data_id_hash, property_version, from_address, to_address) - can this 4-field key be exploited for collision attacks? (Low)

[File: token_claims.rs::CurrentTokenPendingClaim::from_write_table_item()] [Token Amount Mismatch] Amount taken from token.amount - can this differ from offer amount, creating inconsistent claim records? (Medium)

[File: token_claims.rs::CurrentTokenPendingClaim::from_write_table_item()] [Collection ID Consistency] collection_id is derived with 0x prefix - can inconsistency with V1 ID format cause query failures? (Low)

[File: token_claims.rs::CurrentTokenPendingClaim::from_delete_table_item()] [Orphaned Claim Detection] No validation that claim previously existed - can deleting non-existent claims pollute database with zero-amount records? (Low)

[File: token_claims.rs::CurrentTokenPendingClaim::from_write_table_item()] [Table Type Validation Missing] No check that table is PendingClaims type - can claims be created in wrong table types? (Medium)

[File: v2_token_datas.rs::TokenDataV2::get_v2_from_write_resource()] [Missing ObjectCore Early Return] Returns Ok(None) if token_v2_metadata missing ObjectCore - can this silently skip token creation for valid tokens? (High)

[File: v2_token_datas.rs::TokenDataV2::get_v2_from_write_resource()] [Fungible Asset Metadata Confusion] Checks for fungible_asset_metadata to determine token type - can assets with partial metadata be misclassified? (Medium)

[File: v2_token_datas.rs::TokenDataV2::get_v2_from_write_resource()] [Supply Maximum Inconsistency] For fungible tokens, maximum from FungibleAssetSupply but supply from current - can concurrent updates cause maximum < supply? (High)

[File: v2_token_datas.rs::TokenDataV2::get_v2_from_write_resource()] [Property Map Null Default] If property_map missing, defaults to Null - can this hide legitimate properties or cause query failures expecting object properties? (Medium)

[File: v2_token_datas.rs::TokenDataV2::get_v1_from_write_table_item()] [V1/V2 ID Format Mismatch] V1 IDs have 0x prefix while V2 IDs are addresses - can this cause confusion when querying across versions? (Low)
